etymologies: Middle English (denoting the Manx shearwater): apparently from puff+ -ing, with reference to the Manx shearwater's fat nestlings. The later use is a confusion, by association of nesting habits and habitat

definitions: a hole-nesting auk (seabird) of northern and Arctic waters, with a large head and a massive, brightly colored triangular bill.

notes.text: Genera Fratercula and Lunda, family Alcidae: three species, in particular F. arctica

shortDefinitions: seabird with brightly coloured triangular bill
